blueBox.headLine: Mission
content: The Colloquium of Philosophy of Computational Sciences addresses a variety of topics related to the theory of (computational) science and technology for Master and PhD-students as well as postdocs. It is a conjoint colloquium of the RWTH Chair for Theory of Science and Technology (Gabriele Gramelsberger), the TU Chair for Philosophy Darmstadt (Andreas Kaminski) and the Computer Simulation Department of the High Performance Computing Center Stuttgart (HLRS). Beside Master, PhD, and PostDoc project presentations, international speakers are occasionally invited for talks

The colloquium takes place on Thursdays during the lecture period from 3-6 p.m., in case of guest lectures from 4-6 p.m. Location: Online via Zoom or in the CSS Lab (room 410), Theaterplatz 14, Aachen, RWTH Aachen University. Accreditation is required under: daniel.wenz@humtec.rwth-aachen.de
